Package albumcollection

Class CollectionManager

java.lang.Object
albumcollection.CollectionManager
public class CollectionManager extends Object
This is the user interface class that processes the input and output of data
Author:
Ved Patel, Vivek Manthri

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      Runs the Collection Manager, takes in input commands, and calls the appropriate processing method

    • processInputs

      private void processInputs(String input)
      Helper method to process the input command and delegate to the respective methods
      Parameters:
      input - the string representing the command terminal input

    • printAlbums

      private void printAlbums()
      Helper method to print the albums after sorting

    • checkEmptyCollection

      private boolean checkEmptyCollection()
      Helper method to check whether the collection of albums is empty or not
      Returns:
      true if the collection of albums is empty; false if not empty

    • addAlbum

      private void addAlbum(String[] parts)
      Adds an album to the collection and prints out corresponding message. Verifies whether the album Dates are valid and the album exists
      Parameters:
      parts - an array of strings, where each element represents a specific piece of information from the command line argument

    • removeAlbum

      private void removeAlbum(String[] parts)
      Removes an album from the collection and prints out corresponding message. Verifies whether the album actually exists
      Parameters:
      parts - an array of strings, where each element represents a specific piece of information from the command line argument

    • rateAlbum

      private void rateAlbum(String[] parts)
      Rates an album in the collection and prints out corresponding message. Verifies whether the album ratings are within the 1-5 range
      Parameters:
      parts - an array of strings, where each element represents a specific piece of information from the command line argument
